name: Hilton Garden Inn Kansas City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here at the Hilton Garden Inn while visiting Kansas City. Our favorite part were the beds.....INCREDIBLE! The rooms were large and spacious, and the bathroom's large granite counter was awesome, This was perfect in every way, and one we will definitely return to while in the area. Keep up the great job, Hilton!
reviews.title: Great spot!

reviews.text: No restaurants around (the restaurant IN the hotel told me in would be 20 minute before they could actually take my order). Way to staff the restaurant, management!
reviews.title: Why did Hilton put a hotel here?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area leaves a lot to be desired and the hotel furnishings are outdated and old. Likely won't stay here next time I'm in KC.
reviews.title: Not a Bad Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing unsafe about this neighborhood, as some previous posters suggested. It's filled with municipal buildings like the federal courthouse.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the Price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, safe, appropriately appointed and well-maintained.
reviews.title: Standard Hilton Garden Inn

likes.liked: — The price and quality of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — The neighborhood around the hotel is sketchy.

reviews.text: When traveling to Kansas City, friends and business associates have always told me to avoid staying on the Kansas side. Well, my advice is do not discount something until you've tried it. In July I stayed two nights at the Hilton Garden Inn and was pleasantly surprised. The property was excellent. Downtown Kansas City, Missouri is conveniently located a few minutes away by car. While the immediate area around the hotel is uninspiring, it is safe enough for an evening stroll or jog. The front desk staff is absolutely first rate and professional. Parking is onsite in a small parking garage behind the hotel and free. Breakfast at Hilton Garden's is not free; I thought the breakfast buffet is somewhat pricey for what is offered. The eating area offers a small bar open to 10:00 pm for those needing a nightcap. Defintely more quiet on the Kansas side than on the MO side. If your looking for a good nights sleep, I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A convenient location and a great nights sleep

likes.liked: — Location; convenience to highways; away from the noise of downtown Kansas City, MO
likes.disliked: — Views from hotel rooms are not that great

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: We went to KC for the KC Ren Fest. Often after a day at faire, all one wants to do is sit at the bar or in the pool and relax. The "bar" was a couple of barstools at the end of the eating area, we ended up taking our drinks back up to our room. The bartender (and I use the term very loosely) didn't know how to make our fairly common drinks, and once explained, didn't have the ingredients to make them. (no tequilla????) We also had to wait while he served guests their dinners, and ran roomservice up to other guests, and this was a Saturday night. The pool was more like a kiddie pool, not the "olympic sized pool" advertised.
The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was nice enough, but if you're looking for somewhere to do more than sleep, I would look elsewhere
reviews.title: Excellent service...

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was incredible. Very friendly and accommodating. We had been driving all night and just needed to sleep for a few hours. They let us check in very early and allowed us a late check out as well. This hotel was one of the cleanest I have ever been in and I am a travel agent, I have seen plenty of hotels. The pool was a very small, but we didn't want to swim anyway.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Above Average Facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for a week in April 2008. The hotel was great. My wife is in a wheel chair so it was nice to find a disabled room with plenty of space to get around in.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but isolated

reviews.text: The front desk staff were all very helpful and the office staff were great when the printer in the business center went on holiday!
reviews.title: Good hotel, not a great area

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is good and not overpriced but there is little else in walking distance - Downtown is only 10 mins away by car and there is plenty of parking.
reviews.title: Nice but area, restaurant leave a little to be desired

reviews.text: We went to concert at the sprint center and there was plenty of parking at only $10.
reviews.title: Not a bad place - above average, given the location

likes.disliked: — KCK is grubby, it's not the hotel's fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would absolutely recommend this to any one, especially any one handicapped
reviews.title: Good weekend stay

likes.disliked: — not within walking distance of interesting things

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Kansas City Hotel Kansas City
